content.$t:
author: Maria E. Andreu, biography: Maria E. Andreu is the author of Love in English (Balzer + Bray, 2021), an Indie Next Pick and Junior Library Guild Gold Standard Selection, which received a starred review from School Library Journal. Filled with with playful and poetic breakouts exploring the idiosyncrasies of the English language, it tells the tale of Ana, a girl who has recently moved from Argentina to the United States, in a narrative that's layered with themes of immigration, cultural identity, and finding your voice in any language.

Her prior young adult novel, The Secret Side of Empty, tells the story of M.T., an undocumented high school senior, and was inspired by Maria's own experiences of being undocumented. The book is a Junior Library Guild Selection, a National Indie Excellence Book Award winner, an International Latino Book Awards Finalist and has been called "captivating" by School Library Journal. 

Maria's writing has appeared in Literary Hub, Teen Vogue, Newsweek, The Washington Post and NJ.com. She is at work on a memoir about her experiences as an undocumented immigrant and non-native speaker of English. She lives in New Jersey with her two children on a grassy hill frequented by black squirrels, deer with impressive jumping range and the occasional fox and turkey., bookinformation: LOVE IN ENGLISH, 2.2.21, ISBN: 978-0062996510
THE SECRET SIDE OF EMPTY, 7.28.15, ISBN: 978-0762459162, website: https://MariaEAndreu.com, instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mariaeandreu/, twitter: https://twitter.com/WriterSideofM, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/728db5d5-2a79-42e8-867b-672d0bba80df/Andreu.jpg, whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwithreaders: Getting to hear their enthusiasm, and also learning about other books they're reading besides mine. I get so many great book recommendations that way!, whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergottenfromareader: How rich are you now? Answer: SO rich! (Ha ha!)., whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutthecollingswoodbookfestivalifyouvebeenherebefore: I love the energy and the open space. And I can't wait to see people in person again!

gsx$biography.$t:
Maria E. Andreu is the author of Love in English (Balzer + Bray, 2021), an Indie Next Pick and Junior Library Guild Gold Standard Selection, which received a starred review from School Library Journal. Filled with with playful and poetic breakouts exploring the idiosyncrasies of the English language, it tells the tale of Ana, a girl who has recently moved from Argentina to the United States, in a narrative that's layered with themes of immigration, cultural identity, and finding your voice in any language.

Her prior young adult novel, The Secret Side of Empty, tells the story of M.T., an undocumented high school senior, and was inspired by Maria's own experiences of being undocumented. The book is a Junior Library Guild Selection, a National Indie Excellence Book Award winner, an International Latino Book Awards Finalist and has been called "captivating" by School Library Journal. 

Maria's writing has appeared in Literary Hub, Teen Vogue, Newsweek, The Washington Post and NJ.com. She is at work on a memoir about her experiences as an undocumented immigrant and non-native speaker of English. She lives in New Jersey with her two children on a grassy hill frequented by black squirrels, deer with impressive jumping range and the occasional fox and turkey.

gsx$bookinformation.$t:
LOVE IN ENGLISH, 2.2.21, ISBN: 978-0062996510
THE SECRET SIDE OF EMPTY, 7.28.15, ISBN: 978-0762459162

gsx$whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwi.$t: Getting to hear their enthusiasm, and also learning about other books they're reading besides mine. I get so many great book recommendations that way!

gsx$whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergo.$t: How rich are you now? Answer: SO rich! (Ha ha!).

gsx$whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutt.$t: I love the energy and the open space. And I can't wait to see people in person again!

content.$t:
author: Charlotte Bennardo, biography: Former newspaper reporter, paralegal, and teacher, until Hollywood calls, Charlotte lives in New Jersey with her husband, sons, two needy cats, and sometimes a deranged squirrel. Her books include the middle grade trilogy, Evolution Revolution: Simple Machines, Simple Plans, and Simple Lessons. She co-authored Blonde OPS and the Sirenz series: Sirenz, Sirenz Back In Fashion, and two anthologies: Beware the Little White Rabbit and Scare Me to Sleep. Currently she's polishing up several MG, YA, NA and adult novels in various genres., bookinformation: Blonde OPS, 2014, #978-1-250-03039-9 *
Sirenz Back in Fashion, 2012, #978-0-8787-3187-2*
Sirenz, 2011, #978-0-7387-2319-8*
Evolution Revolution: Simple Lessons, 2017, #978-0-9984992-2-2**
Evolution Revolution: Simple Plans, 2017, #978-0-9984992-0-8**
Evolution Revolution: Simple Machines, 2016, #978-15349032-1-0**

* out of print
**Independently published 
 (I would be handselling my own copies of all titles), website: https://charlotteebennardo.blogspot.com/, facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AuthorCharlotteBennardo, twitter: @charbennardo, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/05daad77-9215-413b-bf3d-112bd0cf6d28/Bennardo.jpg, whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwithreaders: I love talking about all things books- what do they like? What do they recommend? What would they like to read?, whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergottenfromareader: How come I wrote about the devil? (reader thought Greek god Hades was the same as the devil), whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutthecollingswoodbookfestivalifyouvebeenherebefore: I LOVE THIS FESTIVAL! It's well managed, the staff totally rocks (even when rain makes it a challenge!) and so many people pass through! And you are open to so many different types of authors- such a diversity of people and genres!

gsx$biography.$t: Former newspaper reporter, paralegal, and teacher, until Hollywood calls, Charlotte lives in New Jersey with her husband, sons, two needy cats, and sometimes a deranged squirrel. Her books include the middle grade trilogy, Evolution Revolution: Simple Machines, Simple Plans, and Simple Lessons. She co-authored Blonde OPS and the Sirenz series: Sirenz, Sirenz Back In Fashion, and two anthologies: Beware the Little White Rabbit and Scare Me to Sleep. Currently she's polishing up several MG, YA, NA and adult novels in various genres.

gsx$whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwi.$t: I love talking about all things books- what do they like? What do they recommend? What would they like to read?

gsx$whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergo.$t: How come I wrote about the devil? (reader thought Greek god Hades was the same as the devil)

gsx$whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutt.$t: I LOVE THIS FESTIVAL! It's well managed, the staff totally rocks (even when rain makes it a challenge!) and so many people pass through! And you are open to so many different types of authors- such a diversity of people and genres!

content.$t:
author: J.A. Culican, biography: J.A. Culican is a USA Today bestselling author of the middle grade fantasy series Keeper of Dragons. Her first novel in the fictional series catapulted a trajectory of titles and awards, including top selling author on the USA Today bestsellers list and Amazon, and a rightfully earned spot as an international best seller. Additional accolades include Best Fantasy Book of 2016, runner-up in Reality Bites Book Awards, and first place for Best Coming of Age Book from the Indie book Awards.

J.A. Culican holds a Master's degree in Special Education from Niagara University, in which she has been teaching special education for over 15 years. She is also the president of the autism awareness non-profit Puzzle Peace United. J.A. Culican resides in southern New Jersey with her husband and four young children., bookinformation: The Prince Returns, Keeper of Dragons book 1: 979-8728327523
How to Kill a Dragon, Heir of Dragons book 1: 978-0692731987, 9781538088395, website: http://www.jaculican.com, facebook: https://www.facebook.com/jaculican, instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jaculican, twitter: https://www.twitter.com/jaculican, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/7f083d06-4182-41de-bcee-00d165aa02a2/Culican.jpg, othersocialmedia: www.pinterest.com/jaculican

Additional accolades include Best Fantasy Book of 2016, runner-up in Reality Bites Book Awards, and first place for Best Coming of Age Book from the Indie book Awards.

content.$t:
author: Luke Cunningham, biography: Luke X. Cunningham is an Emmy-nominated writer from Philadelphia. Previously, he spent three years as a writer for "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon." He developed a passion for the Renaissance while earning a history degree from Brown University. He currently lives in Los Angeles, Calif., with his wife and their son, Finn. LEO: Inventor Extraordinaire is his first novel., bookinformation: Leo: Inventor Extraordinaire published by Zondervan/ HarperCollins on 4/6/2021. 
ISBN 9780310770008, instagram: https://www.instagram.com/leo.inventor.extraordinaire/?hl=en, twitter: @LukeXCunningham, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/b26b93d6-3d67-4e93-b3af-7bc694943a18/Cunningham.jpg, whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwithreaders: I love hearing about what readers connected with in the world built for Leo, Savvy and Wynn Toys. My favorite thing to do is then connect the parts of the story the reader enjoyed with the real historical counterpart that inspired it. E.g., Let's talk about Gemini and Renaissance robot lions!, whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergottenfromareader: Are you sure you did the math right for Leo's birthday and what happened with his parents?, whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutthecollingswoodbookfestivalifyouvebeenherebefore: I grew up in Philadelphia. I am thrilled that I get to come back in October, the king of months, and share my book with my hometown's literary community. 

Leo: Inventor Extraordinaire is the product of writing the book I would've loved when I was in middle school. Hopefully I can connect with current readers, teachers, librarians, and writers at the festival.

gsx$biography.$t: Luke X. Cunningham is an Emmy-nominated writer from Philadelphia. Previously, he spent three years as a writer for "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon." He developed a passion for the Renaissance while earning a history degree from Brown University. He currently lives in Los Angeles, Calif., with his wife and their son, Finn. LEO: Inventor Extraordinaire is his first novel.

gsx$bookinformation.$t:
Leo: Inventor Extraordinaire published by Zondervan/ HarperCollins on 4/6/2021. 
ISBN 9780310770008

gsx$whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwi.$t: I love hearing about what readers connected with in the world built for Leo, Savvy and Wynn Toys. My favorite thing to do is then connect the parts of the story the reader enjoyed with the real historical counterpart that inspired it. E.g., Let's talk about Gemini and Renaissance robot lions!

gsx$whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergo.$t: Are you sure you did the math right for Leo's birthday and what happened with his parents?

gsx$whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutt.$t:
I grew up in Philadelphia. I am thrilled that I get to come back in October, the king of months, and share my book with my hometown's literary community. 

Leo: Inventor Extraordinaire is the product of writing the book I would've loved when I was in middle school. Hopefully I can connect with current readers, teachers, librarians, and writers at the festival.

content.$t:
author: Kwame Ivery, biography: Kwame Ivery was born in Bronx, NY and raised in East Orange, NJ. He received a B.A. in psychology from Princeton University and an M.F.A. in Dramatic Writing from New York University's Tisch School Of The Arts. He's had a screenplay optioned by Hollywood storyboard artist Karl Shefelman (The Silence of the Lambs‚ American Gangster, etc.) He's a proud high school English teacher with 100+ teenage students who, on a daily basis, teach him just as many things as he teaches them. He loves lasagna and hates musicals; he thinks contrasts are underrated and symmetry overrated., bookinformation: TITLE: The Problem with the Other Side
PUBLICATION DATE: September 7, 2021
ISBN: 978-1641292054, website: https://www.kwameivery.com/, facebook: https://www.facebook.com/kwame.ivery, twitter: https://twitter.com/KwameIvery, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/5c4eade7-1116-4929-af1c-f76803fea2fb/Ivery.jpg, whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwithreaders: Answering their questions, whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutthecollingswoodbookfestivalifyouvebeenherebefore: I look forward to meeting readers, answering their questions, and signing copies of my book for them; I also look forward to conversing with other authors.

gsx$biography.$t: Kwame Ivery was born in Bronx, NY and raised in East Orange, NJ. He received a B.A. in psychology from Princeton University and an M.F.A. in Dramatic Writing from New York University's Tisch School Of The Arts. He's had a screenplay optioned by Hollywood storyboard artist Karl Shefelman (The Silence of the Lambs‚ American Gangster, etc.) He's a proud high school English teacher with 100+ teenage students who, on a daily basis, teach him just as many things as he teaches them. He loves lasagna and hates musicals; he thinks contrasts are underrated and symmetry overrated.

gsx$bookinformation.$t:
TITLE: The Problem with the Other Side
PUBLICATION DATE: September 7, 2021
ISBN: 978-1641292054

gsx$whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutt.$t: I look forward to meeting readers, answering their questions, and signing copies of my book for them; I also look forward to conversing with other authors.

content.$t:
author: Cordelia Jensen, biography: Cordelia Jensen graduated with a MFA in Writing for Children & Young Adults from Vermont College of Fine Arts in 2012. Cordelia has three verse novels: Skyscraping (Philomel/Penguin) The Way the Light Bends (Philomel/Penguin) and Every Shiny Thing (Amulet/Abrams), which she co-authored with VCFA classmate Laurie Morrison. Skyscraping was named an American Library Association’s 2016 Best Book for Young Adults, A Los Angeles Public Library’s Best Book for Teens and a 2016 NCTE Children’s Notable Verse Novel. Every Shiny Thing was nominated for the South Carolina Junior Book Award. Cordelia has taught creative writing in a variety of settings: Bryn Mawr College, Germantown Friends School and The Writing Barn. She currently teaches for The Kelly Yang Project and The Highlights Foundation. She also runs a local kids’ literary journal called the Mt. Airy Musers. Cordelia is represented by Sara Crowe of Pippin., bookinformation: Every Shiny Thing, 2018, ‎978-1419733772
The Way the Light Bends, 2018, 978-0399547447, website: http://www.cordeliajensen.com, facebook: https://www.facebook.com/cordeliajensenauthor, instagram: https://www.instragram.com/cordeliajensen1, twitter: https://www.twitter.com/cordeliajensen, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/682eb006-e0e7-472b-9c40-3eb8187dda2d/Jensen_Cordelia.jpg, whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwithreaders: I enjoy hearing what books readers are loving and talking "shop" about writing and reading!, whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergottenfromareader: People often want to know if I designed the cover of the books I write myself! This often leads to a good conversation about book design and all the effort that goes into the creation of each title.

gsx$biography.$t: Cordelia Jensen graduated with a MFA in Writing for Children & Young Adults from Vermont College of Fine Arts in 2012. Cordelia has three verse novels: Skyscraping (Philomel/Penguin) The Way the Light Bends (Philomel/Penguin) and Every Shiny Thing (Amulet/Abrams), which she co-authored with VCFA classmate Laurie Morrison. Skyscraping was named an American Library Association’s 2016 Best Book for Young Adults, A Los Angeles Public Library’s Best Book for Teens and a 2016 NCTE Children’s Notable Verse Novel. Every Shiny Thing was nominated for the South Carolina Junior Book Award. Cordelia has taught creative writing in a variety of settings: Bryn Mawr College, Germantown Friends School and The Writing Barn. She currently teaches for The Kelly Yang Project and The Highlights Foundation. She also runs a local kids’ literary journal called the Mt. Airy Musers. Cordelia is represented by Sara Crowe of Pippin.

gsx$bookinformation.$t:
Every Shiny Thing, 2018, ‎978-1419733772
The Way the Light Bends, 2018, 978-0399547447

gsx$whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwi.$t: I enjoy hearing what books readers are loving and talking "shop" about writing and reading!

gsx$whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergo.$t: People often want to know if I designed the cover of the books I write myself! This often leads to a good conversation about book design and all the effort that goes into the creation of each title.

content.$t:
author: Laurie Morrison, biography: Laurie Morrison taught middle school for 10 years and now writes novels for readers who are (or have at one point been) 10-14 years old. She is the coauthor of Every Shiny Thing and the author of Up for Air, Saint Ivy, and Coming Up Short (forthcoming in 2022). Laurie's books have received starred reviews and been chosen as Junior Library Guild Gold Standard Selections and finalists for state award lists. Laurie holds an MFA in Writing for Children and Young Adults from Vermont College of Fine Arts, and she lives with her family in Philadelphia, where she loves to read, bake, and be outside., bookinformation: SAINT IVY: KIND AT ALL COSTS, 5/18/21, 978-1-4197-4125-8
UP FOR AIR, 4/13/21 (paperback), 978-1-4197-5142-4
EVERY SHINY THING, 4/9/19 (paperback), 978-1-4197-3377-2, website: https://lauriemorrisonwrites.com, instagram: https://www.instagram.com/laurielmorrison/, twitter: https://twitter.com/LaurieLMorrison, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/4ca85358-0e3d-4df5-93ff-703fa227ae04/Morrison.jpeg, whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwithreaders: I love talking with readers about books they love, whether they're my own books or not! It's so much fun to hear what readers connect with--which characters they loved or couldn't stand, which parts of a story they could relate to most, or how a book made them feel.

gsx$biography.$t: Laurie Morrison taught middle school for 10 years and now writes novels for readers who are (or have at one point been) 10-14 years old. She is the coauthor of Every Shiny Thing and the author of Up for Air, Saint Ivy, and Coming Up Short (forthcoming in 2022). Laurie's books have received starred reviews and been chosen as Junior Library Guild Gold Standard Selections and finalists for state award lists. Laurie holds an MFA in Writing for Children and Young Adults from Vermont College of Fine Arts, and she lives with her family in Philadelphia, where she loves to read, bake, and be outside.

gsx$bookinformation.$t:
SAINT IVY: KIND AT ALL COSTS, 5/18/21, 978-1-4197-4125-8
UP FOR AIR, 4/13/21 (paperback), 978-1-4197-5142-4
EVERY SHINY THING, 4/9/19 (paperback), 978-1-4197-3377-2

gsx$whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwi.$t: I love talking with readers about books they love, whether they're my own books or not! It's so much fun to hear what readers connect with--which characters they loved or couldn't stand, which parts of a story they could relate to most, or how a book made them feel.

content.$t:
author: David Neilsen, biography: David Neilsen is the author of two Middle Grade horror, comic, and fantasies published by Crown Books for Young Readers. His debut novel, Dr. Fell and the Playground of Doom, was named an Editor's Pick by Amazon, won the Silver Falchion Award for Best YA/Tween Horror or Fantasy of 2017, and was a Semifinalist for Best Middle Grade/Children's Book in the 2016 Goodreads Choice Awards. His second book, Beyond the Doors, was published in August 2017.

Before turning to slightly creepy children's literature, David spent a dozen years working as a writer in Hollywood, culminating in optioning a pilot to 20th Century Fox (that went nowhere), and penning the screenplay for the Straight-to-DVD film‚ The Eliminator, (stream it, he dares you).

A classically trained actor, David works as a professional storyteller based in Sleepy Hollow, NY and spends much of October spooking the bejeebers out of people or performing one of his one-man shows based on and inspired by the works of H. P. Lovecraft. He lives with his wife, son, daughter, and two very domineering cats., bookinformation: Dr. Fell and the Playground of Doom, August 2016, ISBN: 978-1101935811
Beyond the Doors, August 2017, ISBN: 978-1101935828, website: http://david-neilsen.com, facebook: https://www.facebook.com/davidneilsenauthor, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/08a92a3f-cf2c-4a0c-9fbe-145cadb07543/Neilsen.jpg, whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwithreaders: I love meeting them and bringing a smile to their face with a quip or a joke or just by being silly., whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergottenfromareader: Backstory: The cover of Dr. Fell and the Playground of Doom depicts Dr. Fell with a purple tophat. I own a purple tophat that I bring to events and wear. One child met me, saw the cover, and asked "Is that supposed to be you?", whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutthecollingswoodbookfestivalifyouvebeenherebefore: Collingswood is such a special place, I am looking forward to just being back and seeing the other authors and interacting with readers.

His debut novel, Dr. Fell and the Playground of Doom, was named an Editor's Pick by Amazon, won the Silver Falchion Award for Best YA/Tween Horror or Fantasy of 2017, and was a Semifinalist for Best Middle Grade/Children's Book in the 2016 Goodreads Choice Awards. His second book, Beyond the Doors, was published in August 2017.

Before turning to slightly creepy children's literature, David spent a dozen years working as a writer in Hollywood, culminating in optioning a pilot to 20th Century Fox (that went nowhere), and penning the screenplay for the Straight-to-DVD film‚ The Eliminator, (stream it, he dares you).

A classically trained actor, David works as a professional storyteller based in Sleepy Hollow, NY and spends much of October spooking the bejeebers out of people or performing one of his one-man shows based on and inspired by the works of H. P. Lovecraft. He lives with his wife, son, daughter, and two very domineering cats.

gsx$bookinformation.$t:

gsx$whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwi.$t: I love meeting them and bringing a smile to their face with a quip or a joke or just by being silly.

gsx$whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergo.$t: Backstory: The cover of Dr. Fell and the Playground of Doom depicts Dr. Fell with a purple tophat. I own a purple tophat that I bring to events and wear. One child met me, saw the cover, and asked "Is that supposed to be you?"

gsx$whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutt.$t: Collingswood is such a special place, I am looking forward to just being back and seeing the other authors and interacting with readers.

content.$t:
author: Colleen Rowan Kosinski, biography: Colleen Rowan Kosinski grew up in Collingswood, NJ. She is the author of Lilla's Sunflowers, A Promise Stitched in Time, A Home Again, and Love Made Me More. She received her B.A. from Rutgers University in visual art, is an alumna of Philadelphia's Moore College of Art, and spent many years as a successful freelance fine artist. She resides in New Jersey with her family., bookinformation: My newest book. A HOME AGAIN will be available to order on 9/20. 978-1542007207 (Two Lions)
A PROMISE STITCHED IN TIME 978-0764355547 (Schiffer)

content.$t:
author: Dianne Salerni, biography: Dianne K. Salerni is the author of middle grade and YA novels, including Eleanor, Alice, & the Roosevelt Ghosts, The Eighth Day Series, The Caged Graves, and We Hear the Dead. Her seventh book, Jadie in Five Dimensions, a multi-dimensional adventure steeped in geometry, monsters, kidnappings, and conspiracy theories, will be released in September 2021. Dianne was a public school teacher for 25 years before leaving the profession to spend more time hanging around creepy cemeteries and climbing 2,000 year-old pyramids in the name of book research. She currently volunteers weekly at her local animal shelter, serving  the needs of dogs, rabbits, guinea pigs, and feline overlords., bookinformation: JADIE IN FIVE DIMENSIONS (2021) 978-0823449095
ELEANOR, ALICE, & THE ROOSEVELT GHOSTS (2020) 978-0823449910
THE EIGHTH DAY Bk 1 (2014) 978-0062272164
THE INQUISITOR'S MARK  Bk2 (2015) 978-0062272195
THE MORRIGAN'S CURSE Bk 3 (2016)  978-0062272225, website: https://diannesalerni.com/, facebook: https://www.facebook.com/DianneKSalerni, twitter: https://twitter.com/diannesalerni, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/bbb3dc1a-182a-4998-bfc1-b6f57a859e39/Salerni.jpg, whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwithreaders: I love seeing a reader's eyes light up when the find a book that captures their imagination., whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergottenfromareader: I sometimes get asked questions about the future romances of MG characters in the Eighth Day series., whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutthecollingswoodbookfestivalifyouvebeenherebefore: I am looking forward to sharing my two newest books -- Eleanor, Alice, & the Roosevelt Ghosts and Jadie in Five Dimensions -- to the faithful readers in Collingswood who devoured my Eighth Day series. Because of the pandemic, I have never gotten to celebrate these books with readers.

gsx$biography.$t: Dianne K. Salerni is the author of middle grade and YA novels, including Eleanor, Alice, & the Roosevelt Ghosts, The Eighth Day Series, The Caged Graves, and We Hear the Dead. Her seventh book, Jadie in Five Dimensions, a multi-dimensional adventure steeped in geometry, monsters, kidnappings, and conspiracy theories, will be released in September 2021. Dianne was a public school teacher for 25 years before leaving the profession to spend more time hanging around creepy cemeteries and climbing 2,000 year-old pyramids in the name of book research. She currently volunteers weekly at her local animal shelter, serving  the needs of dogs, rabbits, guinea pigs, and feline overlords.

gsx$bookinformation.$t:
JADIE IN FIVE DIMENSIONS (2021) 978-0823449095
ELEANOR, ALICE, & THE ROOSEVELT GHOSTS (2020) 978-0823449910
THE EIGHTH DAY Bk 1 (2014) 978-0062272164
THE INQUISITOR'S MARK  Bk2 (2015) 978-0062272195
THE MORRIGAN'S CURSE Bk 3 (2016)  978-0062272225

gsx$whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwi.$t: I love seeing a reader's eyes light up when the find a book that captures their imagination.

gsx$whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergo.$t: I sometimes get asked questions about the future romances of MG characters in the Eighth Day series.

gsx$whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutt.$t: I am looking forward to sharing my two newest books -- Eleanor, Alice, & the Roosevelt Ghosts and Jadie in Five Dimensions -- to the faithful readers in Collingswood who devoured my Eighth Day series. Because of the pandemic, I have never gotten to celebrate these books with readers.

content.$t:
author: Laura Sibson, biography: After a career in undergraduate counseling, Laura Sibson pursued an MFA from Vermont College of Fine Arts. When she's not drinking impossibly strong coffee while writing, you can find her running the neighborhood streets or hiking with her dog. She lives with her family in the furthest edge of Philadelphia. Laura teaches creative writing at Arcadia University and at the Highlights Foundation. The Art of Breaking Things, her debut novel was named on YALSA's Best Fiction for Young Adults 2020. Her second young adult novel with Viking, Edie In Between, comes out in August 2021., bookinformation: EDIE IN BETWEEN (8/24/21) ISBN: 9780451481146
THE ART OF BREAKING THINGS (6/18/19) ISBN: 9780451481115, website: http://laurasibson.com/, facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AuthorLauraSibson, instagram: https://instagram.com/lauraosibson, twitter: @laurasibson, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/a31877e3-cf13-4052-99ed-32429fd20af5/Sibson.jpg, whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwithreaders: I love hearing what grabs readers about the books they read. I enjoy answering questions about my books. I also relish inspiring young people toward reading and writing., whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergottenfromareader: Can't think of any!, whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutthecollingswoodbookfestivalifyouvebeenherebefore: I love the sense of community that in created by the organizers of the Collingswood Book Festival!

gsx$biography.$t: After a career in undergraduate counseling, Laura Sibson pursued an MFA from Vermont College of Fine Arts. When she's not drinking impossibly strong coffee while writing, you can find her running the neighborhood streets or hiking with her dog. She lives with her family in the furthest edge of Philadelphia. Laura teaches creative writing at Arcadia University and at the Highlights Foundation. The Art of Breaking Things, her debut novel was named on YALSA's Best Fiction for Young Adults 2020. Her second young adult novel with Viking, Edie In Between, comes out in August 2021.

gsx$bookinformation.$t:
EDIE IN BETWEEN (8/24/21) ISBN: 9780451481146
THE ART OF BREAKING THINGS (6/18/19) ISBN: 9780451481115

gsx$whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwi.$t: I love hearing what grabs readers about the books they read. I enjoy answering questions about my books. I also relish inspiring young people toward reading and writing.

gsx$whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutt.$t: I love the sense of community that in created by the organizers of the Collingswood Book Festival!

content.$t: author: Yvonne Ventresca, biography: Yvonne Ventresca's latest fiction, The Third Ghost was selected as the title story for the middle grade adventure anthology, Voyagers: The Third Ghost. She is also the award-winning author of two young adult novels: Black Flowers, White Lies (a psychological thriller) and Pandemic (from 2014, eerily predictive about a deadly illness that strikes our contemporary world)., bookinformation: Voyagers: The Third Ghost 978-1939844729, website: http://YvonneVentresca.com, facebook: https://www.facebook.com/yvonneventrescaauthor, instagram: https://instagram.com/yvonneventresca, twitter: https://twitter.com/YvonneVentresca, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/eb59b2a5-ec99-4873-bb2e-1c3397d74bbe/Ventresca.jpg, othersocialmedia: www.pinterest.com/yvonneventresca, whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwithreaders: I love to hear about other people's favorite books., whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutthecollingswoodbookfestivalifyouvebeenherebefore: It will be great to meet Collingswood readers and book lovers again in person.

gsx$biography.$t: Yvonne Ventresca's latest fiction, The Third Ghost was selected as the title story for the middle grade adventure anthology, Voyagers: The Third Ghost. She is also the award-winning author of two young adult novels: Black Flowers, White Lies (a psychological thriller) and Pandemic (from 2014, eerily predictive about a deadly illness that strikes our contemporary world).

gsx$whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwi.$t: I love to hear about other people's favorite books.

gsx$whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutt.$t: It will be great to meet Collingswood readers and book lovers again in person.

content.$t:
author: Nancy Viau, biography: Nancy Viau is the award-winning author of the following picture books: Today Is a Beach Day!, First Snow, City Street Beat, Storm Song, Look What I Can Do! and Pruett and Soo (2022). Her middle-grade novels include Samantha Hansen Has Rocks in Her Head (updated for 2019), Something Is Bugging Samantha Hansen, Just One Thing! and Beauty and Bernice. A former teacher, librarian, and all-around kid-at-heart, Viau loves to visit schools, libraries, and bookstores across the United States to lead story times, teach writing workshops, and present assembly programs about her journey to publication and the writing process., bookinformation: Today Is a Beach Day!

978-0-7643-5162-4, website: https://www.nancyviau.com/, facebook: https://www.facebook.com/nancy.viau.39, instagram: https://www.instagram.com/nancyviau1/, twitter: https://twitter.com/NancyViau1, profileimage: https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5f1cb0d99322d817a05021ad/e074520e-ca1d-4153-b91d-393fd8447671/Viau.jpeg, whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwithreaders: I love it when readers find themselves in a word, sentence, paragraph, or an entire BOOK that I have created. In my story telling I have always wanted them to know, "I remember; I see you; I understand.", whatistheweirdestquestionyouveevergottenfromareader: "You were ALIVE in the 1980s??", whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutthecollingswoodbookfestivalifyouvebeenherebefore: Oh, how I have missed connecting with kids, teachers, and parents IN PERSON! I cannot wait to meet new booklovers and talk about reading, writing, and ALL the children's (and adult) books I have enjoyed.

gsx$biography.$t: Nancy Viau is the award-winning author of the following picture books: Today Is a Beach Day!, First Snow, City Street Beat, Storm Song, Look What I Can Do! and Pruett and Soo (2022). Her middle-grade novels include Samantha Hansen Has Rocks in Her Head (updated for 2019), Something Is Bugging Samantha Hansen, Just One Thing! and Beauty and Bernice. A former teacher, librarian, and all-around kid-at-heart, Viau loves to visit schools, libraries, and bookstores across the United States to lead story times, teach writing workshops, and present assembly programs about her journey to publication and the writing process.

gsx$whatsyourfavoritethingaboutmeetingwi.$t: I love it when readers find themselves in a word, sentence, paragraph, or an entire BOOK that I have created. In my story telling I have always wanted them to know, "I remember; I see you; I understand."

gsx$whatareyoumostlookingforwardtoaboutt.$t: Oh, how I have missed connecting with kids, teachers, and parents IN PERSON! I cannot wait to meet new booklovers and talk about reading, writing, and ALL the children's (and adult) books I have enjoyed.
